title.narrative: Enhance Member Commitment & member services improvement

description.narrative: 2020 our collaboration will look more on member services and commitment of the member youth involvement in election and feasibility study on fertilizer factory

NJORECU's goal is to improve the member commitment and service provision to members processing maize by establishing maize milling machine for the benefits for the farmers and supply farm input on minimum and affordable price to its members

Initially the Union was registered as NJOLUMA meaning NJOMBE LUDEWA AND MAKETE FARMERS COOPERATIVE UNION in the year 1985 with registration number 5050 and started operations in 1987. The main role of the union was to provide services on input supply and crop marketing of its members.

In the year 1995 the union failed to perform its core business activities due to lack of working capital following withdraw of the government to guarantee loans of cooperative unions from financial institutions. After a long period without business NJOLUMAFU restarted again in 2013 following a directive by regional commissioner to track all economic-cooperative entities in the region and identify their properties.

Various efforts were undertaken to ensure the UNION is re-established Cooperative registrar at regional level conducted meetings in primary cooperative societies where caretaker committees were put inplace. The registrar convened the first general meeting in April 2013 in that meeting members proposed and approved the name NJORECU (Njombe Regional cooperative Union) to be the new name for their UNION instead of NJOLUMAFCU. After consensus process of registration of new name took place and was successful..
